website_summaries.verdict: Provides an affordable and comfortable way to add protection in most types of calm and inland waters.
pros: A Type II rated vest capable of turning the majority of unconscious wearers face up in water – better buoyancy than type III models
Offers a budget-friendly price and a comfortable fit
cons: Though recommended for wearers at least 90 lbs, sizes tend to run small
Not rated for wear in rough waters
Basic – no pockets or other extras

customer_reviews.title: They keep me USCG legal
customer_reviews.text: These are simple, basic life preservers which are not intended for long-term survival. As such, they're fine, they keep me USCG legal at a very low cost. I bought a pair of these & added a couple of whistles. The labeling on the preservers is clear & easy to understand, also informative if you haven't researched 'personal flotation devices'. I would've given 5 stars but I can't. Even understanding their intended use, and allowing for the low price, they won't get that last star. These life 'vests' are cheaply made and won't last long unless they never get used.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: amazingly visible and safe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great life jacket. My favorite part as a mom (aside from safety) is I can see my child in it from a great distance (while on the kayak). Normally I buy the newer style ski jacket/vest, but so glad we got this one due to its extreme visibility and ability to roll the person on his back should something happen. Plus, this is actually easier when paddling as it won’t cut under the arm.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Roach

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Good
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? They are very inexpensive, Coast Guard rated, comfortable and adjustable... We got used to them very quickly and don't even think about them when they're on. We capsized once and found that they really work - wife and I are both good swimmers, but these PFDs allowed us to relax and just leisurely kick paddle ourselves back to shore, while hanging onto the gear we didn't want to lose.
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Solid, standard life preserver.
customer_reviews.text: Most important to me is the flotation material inside. It appears to be closed cell foam, which over time, should not break down and begin to absorb water. The universal size goes up to fitting only a medium sized male body - say about a chest size 40 sports coat. If you're bigger or taller than 6', go to the bigger size unit. Good construction, no unnecessary frills. Solid stitching and clasp. Very bright orange. I haven't tried one in the water, but it should work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Augustyniak

customer_reviews.title: it makes you look like a TITANIC survivor - Cheers
customer_reviews.text: Fairly priced, haven't used it in the water yet so yeah...maybe i shouldn't be giving it 5 stars quite yet. anyhow, feels durable, and its U.S. coast guard approved. Also... it makes you look like a TITANIC survivor - Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Lew

customer_reviews.title: These jackets are great if you are looking for a cheap life jacket ...
customer_reviews.text: These jackets are great if you are looking for a cheap life jacket to keep you out of trouble. That being said I would hate to wear this jacket for any period of time. They are extremely uncomfortable
customer_reviews.author: DJ Green

customer_reviews.title: making paddling with this attached to the board easy. You can't beat the price either
customer_reviews.text: I bought this simple PFD to avoid getting ticketed by our local enforcement while I'm using my SUP. It meets local code and is relatively flat, making paddling with this attached to the board easy. You can't beat the price either!
customer_reviews.author: SprinklesHikes

customer_reviews.title: Cheap not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is an economy life jacket. Don’t except max comfort from it only safety and coast guard compliance. I checked with local coast guard and it is accepted. These will save your life but if you go out often get a more form fitted one instead. These are giant blocks which lessen motion and comfort
customer_reviews.author: David Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Small for adults but great for kids
customer_reviews.text: This adult sized cheap life jacket fits my 8 and 11 year old kids great. I am too large for a comfortable fit. Definitely need an extended size for average sized adults. I’m using these for my kids only and back-up vests to keep with us adults when kayaking on mellow lakes.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyx3Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Way too expensive for some normal life perseveres!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like it it’s way too expensive. I purchased a set of four of the same orange life preservers at a local store for less than this one individual life preserver! The seller called me & yelled at me when I left him a review!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: I used it at high speed boating and these type of jackets also act to keep your neck from snapping as a nice aside. They are the only type that actually ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits well. I used it at high speed boating and these type of jackets also act to keep your neck from snapping as a nice aside. They are the only type that actually keep your head above water if you go unconscious. Other full jackets you have a 50/50 shot.
customer_reviews.author: genegenre

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap....that's all I wanted and needed. We won't really need them, but we have to have them per water safety rules. So I got the cheapest! They're totally bulky and uncomfortable, but I don't much care, since we won't be wearing them much. We just have to follow the red tape.
customer_reviews.author: marnster

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 240 pounds and this simple life vest held my head above the water in my pool. Cannot ask for more at this price
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Serve their purpose, but buy a nicer one and actually wear it!!
customer_reviews.text: These are good to meet the legal requirement. You don’t want to be wearing these while out and about though. They are bulky, and a bit ugly. Buy an inflatable type vest to wear and store these on the boat for use in an emergency and to fill the legal requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: I am 5'3 and it fit fine. I am grateful that I didn't have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Our family ordered these in anticipation of hurricane Irma. Since I do not know how to swim and in case our area got flooded, I would have it. I am 5'3 and it fit fine. I am grateful that I didn't have to use it. But, I will now have them if needed.
customer_reviews.author: gladysm

customer_reviews.title: It is more like a safe "board" that is put on your neck
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic set of life vest. However, it is cheap and gets the job done. Nothing to complain. It is more like a safe "board" that is put on your neck, so if you really want a "vest", you'll need to spend a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Natte

customer_reviews.title: short use only.
customer_reviews.text: If you need to have a life-jacket around this if for you, it keeps you up and will flip you onto your back to keep your head above the water. Only problem is its very unconformable to wear. The life-jacket its awkward to wear and hugs your neck. I would not recommend this for long time wearing, but if you are teaching how to use a life-jacket or need them to keep on your boat go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Hope A.

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these to use for a camping trip on ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use for a camping trip on an island. An inflatable boat was also purchased, but state law required life jackets in a boat of that nature. We didn't want to risk any fines or tickets from NPS rangers, so these were a cheap option. They fit well, and we didn't quite get to test their flotation capability (thankfully), but we were confident they would get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: PETER Y.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you get
customer_reviews.text: I needed something coast guard approved to not get a ticket while paddle boarding. This attached easy enough to the bungee cords on my board. For the money it gets the job done. They're so bulky and cumbersome though.
customer_reviews.author: Darren C

customer_reviews.title: They all float down here! muhahahaha
customer_reviews.text: Standard coast guard jacket. I wore it once to test while using my canoe. Quite comfy and easy to put on. Now, I just carry it as precaution in my boat. It makes a nice cushion too. It provides a nice head/neck rest if you are in a lying down position. You will be happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: bean

customer_reviews.title: Don’t mess with a classic!
customer_reviews.text: I’m legally required to have a life jacket on my paddle board and this does the trick! I’ve never actually worn it but it clips nicely to the bungees on my board and keeps the law off my back!
customer_reviews.author: AJ Paulson

customer_reviews.title: Good but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Like these and needed them and they weren’t out yet in stores. You can get them for a fraction of the price at Walmart so while they are what we expected, we paid way way more than we will in the future for these.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Basic and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap life vest that met what we needed to have in our kayaks to be compliant on the water. Wouldn't choose it for one that you would need to wear all the time however.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Good jacket for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good jacket for the price. Bought to have on board incase the warden showed :) Good for storage and use if needed. My son used it to tread water and it kept him up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Item was as described and is satisfactorily constructed. Fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Item was as described and is satisfactorily constructed. Fit is appropriate for its purpose. I purchased this to be compliant with state regulations for kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: Vikki M.

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive life vest
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, inexpensive, life vest to satisfy the requirement for everyone on board to have one. It's not something I'd plan on wearing all the time but it does exactly what we need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good price and they work perfectly for floating down the river.
customer_reviews.author: C.W. Rinker

customer_reviews.title: Good comfort and value.
customer_reviews.text: Great price and good quality make this life preserver a solid choice. No point in paying too much for something I'm only strapping to the side of my kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Josh N

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Airhead Adult Universal Type 2 USCG Approved Life Jacket and use it when I go out in the ocean on my kayak . I really like the fit and it doesn't interfere with my paddling motion. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Kaneyuki

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice jackets. Bought a bunch of them to meet code for a pontoon.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing... u float and can also play with this as a float toy... dnt need any other noodle or floating things in pools ...

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: meets state requirements for Type II life jacket and cheep
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Calm Conditions Only
customer_reviews.text: Good for near-shore use in lakes or along the coast. Definitely NOT FOR USE OFFSHORE OR IN WINDY OR ROUGH WATER CONDITIONS.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Penhune

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and uncomfortable. It is hard to breathe when I have this life jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good for lakes and ponds
customer_reviews.text: Good for lakes and ponds Do not recommend for the ocean. Would not wear in a river with strong currents either.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Calvillo

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I Don’t plan on using these unless for emergencies. Kept in plastic and put in my boat. Quality looks good and it is certified by coast guard
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I just bought this cheap life vest to comply with ...
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this cheap life vest to comply with the USCG regulation while paddle boarding. I have another, nicer one, but didn't want to strap that to the board and have it soak in salty water.
customer_reviews.author: H. Csuri

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works. It also served as a fun, signable trophy for a team sailing award.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Klinefelter

customer_reviews.title: This is a bulky safety device, but I would ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a bulky safety device, but I would rather be safe than sorry, always! We use it with our boats, and insist on everyone being safe when we are out on water.
customer_reviews.author: Susio

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and safety
customer_reviews.text: Good value and good quality. Good price just what I needed to be boat ready.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheap version of the PFD and it works just fine. It sucks when the water police make you get out for lack of a PFD.
customer_reviews.author: TC505

customer_reviews.title: Could no longer use this item
customer_reviews.text: I took this to Miami to the beach I find it very dangerous
customer_reviews.author: Have and Have Nots I did not receive that item please credit back to my account my name is Beverly Waters

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Smaller in size than I expected, but works very well and fits very snug for an average adult. The colour is highly visible and the straps seem to be durable. Would recommend to anyone considering purchasing life vests for adults or teenagers, but are on a tight budget.
customer_reviews.author: David Mootoo

customer_reviews.title: Pure value
customer_reviews.text: Great value, it will work, comfortable and it keeps the rangers and fines away when at the river

customer_reviews.title: A basic vest that should work well if needed.
customer_reviews.text: It is well made and should last a long time. It was bought for use on a farm pond for a person who cannot swim.

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Used it in the sea Served it's purpose Very light and comfortable Has adjustable straps. Don't worry about the fit

customer_reviews.title: Nice life vest
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and thick. Got these because they are supposed to keep you face up in case you're unconscious in the water.

customer_reviews.title: cheap but work great
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought SUP boards and needed life jackets to take out on our boards, these are great. Base level and not the most comfortable but work great for what we bought them for.

customer_reviews.text: A little expensive for its basic quality but just what I need to throw in the kayaks.

customer_reviews.text: Purchase these before our pontoon boat and these are a perfect match for the ones we already have

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver.

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Not only will they be there to ...

customer_reviews.title: Great vest and price

customer_reviews.title: just an item I needed, best value I could find. received quick and as described.
customer_reviews.text: just an item I needed, best value I could find. received quick and as described.

customer_reviews.title: No defects. Universal fit.
customer_reviews.text: We use them for kayaking and boating frequently. They fit everyone, large & small. Haven't had any issues with them.

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Order these for a float trip down the river. They worked well not very comfortable but serve their purpose. Would not recommend to someone who was into more water sports.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, economical
customer_reviews.text: Good life preservers. Nothing fancy, just reliable. Well worth price. Better than I expected product.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.title: low cost compliance.
customer_reviews.text: staying within the law... that's why you buy this. its not comfortable really. its light, and orange... go out there and stay legal with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Shaw

customer_reviews.title: 90lbs adults size!!!! Buy the xxxl
customer_reviews.text: The univeral adult is only uscg rated for 90lbs... dont know many 90lbs adults.

customer_reviews.title: A standard life jacket

customer_reviews.title: Cheap AND light
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and light. I won’t test them but they look like they’ll do the job.

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need it to. Needed it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works for what I need it to. Needed it as a onboard life vest for my kayak. I would go with a different style if I had tip where it for any length of time.
customer_reviews.author: john van hoorn

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it was described
customer_reviews.text: I truly hope I never NEED it but wanted to have it just in case. I am not a swimmer and just want to be safe and not sorry.
customer_reviews.author: ROCHELLE L.

customer_reviews.title: A life vest is a life vest
customer_reviews.text: Got it because floating on river requires a life vest- by law- It does he job well

customer_reviews.title: Passes USCG safety inspection
customer_reviews.text: Will presumably keep you from from drowning also, should you ever have to put it on.

customer_reviews.text: Cheap life jacket to have in the boat nothing special

customer_reviews.title: This does exactly what I need it to do - ...
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I need it to do - have a PFD on my SUP board. I slip it under the bungees on my board, and ride.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for meeting requirements
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for meeting the minimum requirements when you're doing something safe on the water and know you don't actually need a life vest. For example kayaking on a small lake.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Needed this for my stand up paddle board after I ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for my stand up paddle board after I was pulled over by the Bay Constable for not having a life vest on my board. It is a typical life jacket---I hope I never have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: readabookaday

customer_reviews.title: Could not ask for better!
customer_reviews.text: It is very comfortable and very affordable. It meets the requirements for a Coast Guard certified jacket so I can not complain!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It would probably be ok for kids or just to ...
customer_reviews.text: It would probably be ok for kids or just to have for emergencies, but it was very awkward to actually wear for kayaking or in general.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Bought the Kent Type II for compliance and price!
customer_reviews.text: I hope these jackets never touch the water. I bought 10 units in order to comply with the laws. Purchasing 4 compared to the West Marine 4-pack saves about $7-10. They also come in individual bags instead of the four pack holder which is really nice. They tuck nicely under the seats. The bags keep them dry in storage. I would recommend these to a friend. Good luck and happy boating!
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Great price and serves their purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like good quality and serves their purpose. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime @ Sewitsforsale Facebook Group

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap, and annoying to wear. I don’t recommend it.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this lifevest. It's easy to use and does the job.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 8 and 6 year old granddaughters fine. Keeps their head above water
customer_reviews.author: Lan

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Want something cheap for your small fishing boat this is it! If I were fishing on larger water I would probably get some more substantial though! But for just something to throw in a Jon boat it works fine as I don't plan on wearing it anyway!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Shores

customer_reviews.title: Great product that is certified for the water
customer_reviews.text: Great product that is certified for the water. I was a little hesitant about the size because of other reviews that I read but it is a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina J

customer_reviews.title: Meet the requirement
customer_reviews.text: These are good cheap life jackets that fulfill the Coastguard requirement for each occupant of your boat. I would not use these if you are going to wear your life jacket for any amount of time as they are not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: rlakeman

customer_reviews.title: Boating safety.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for extras on our boat. Safety first. This is a better piece than we found in store!

customer_reviews.title: Cheap enough to buy how ever many you need!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and make my boat legal for all my riders!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: What a great deal!
customer_reviews.text: These are well designed and manufactured. And what a great price! Just couldnt beat the price. Especially when they are more of a safety tool for the boat and not consistently used. Couldnt see paying big dollars on cool vests when they really dont get much use. But they are required.
customer_reviews.author: mudstock

customer_reviews.title: A very good, basic PFD.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for the price. Just what we needed and expected. A very good, basic PFD.

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. We use this as a backup life vest in a storm shelter. It is mediocre quality but it does what it intends to do and is inexpensive. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Healthy FitMom

customer_reviews.title: Great basic life jacket, good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to strap onto my stand-up paddle board. Perfect for that use. I don't ever wear it, just carry it because it's required. Didn't want to spend a lot of money so this was the perfect solution. My husband bought a similar one at a sporting goods store and he likes mine better.
customer_reviews.author: millemar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Life jackets of regular quality, keeping as a safeguard for any emergency.

customer_reviews.text: I liked the low cost and high comfort value of this product. When I didn't have it on it doubled as a seat cushion for my kayak!!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

product_meta.title: Airhead Type II Keyhole Life Jacket
feature_bullets: Basic flotation for the boating enthusiast
Designed specifically to provide minimum buoyancy and turn an unconscious person face up in calm water situations
Waist belt, Absolute Outdoor Kent Adult Over 90-Pound Compliance PFD Type II Life Jacket (Orange)
